programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Climate Crisis"
programme.desc: The real impact of global warming is now being felt in communities around the world. Climate scientists explain what to expect where you live, and what steps might still be taken to reverse the climate crises.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Space Junk Dangers"
programme.desc: A ballistic missile test by India recently shot down one of its own communications satellites. With over 900,000 pieces of debris currently orbiting planet Earth, space trash has become a very real threat to ongoing missions.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Chasing a Comet"
programme.desc: COLD WAR & THE START OF THE SPACE RACE – Cold War rivalry and the acceleration of space exploration. SERVICING HUBBLE - Preparations for Hubble’s final servicing mission. CHASING A COMET - Launch and the difficult path to rendezvous.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Mars Express"
programme.desc: PROJECT MERCURY BEGINS - The start of NASA & America’s first manned space program. MARS EXPRESS - The European Space Agency’s Mars Satellite. THE SOYUZ LAUNCH SYSTEM - The gradual evolution of Russia’s Soyuz launcher.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Mercury Advances"
programme.desc: PROJECT MERCURY ADVANCES - America’s first manned space program finally puts a man in orbit. CAMERA TRACKING - The array of special cameras that follow a spacecraft at launch.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Venus Express"
programme.desc: PROJECT GEMINI COMMENCES - Did Gemini give the US a lead in the space race? VENUS EXPRESS - The last days of ESA’s Venus probe. EMU NASA’s - Extravehicular Mobility Unit. DEEP SPACE COMMUNICATIONS - ESA’s worldwide network of giant dishes.

programme.title: How to Bulid a City S1 - "New York"
programme.desc: New York, New York. A city so nice, they named it twice. The cultural and financial capital of the world. Join us as we navigate the gridlocked streets and canyons created by Manhattan’s skyscrapers and marvel at the engineering wonder of the subway.

programme.title: How to Bulid a City S1 - "Paris"
programme.desc: The celebration of culture and conservation of heritage underpin this episode on the City of Light. Home to engineering marvels, such as the Eiffel Tower and the glass pyramid entrance to the Louvre, Paris holds a special place in our imaginations.

programme.title: Space Greed S1 - "Above The Law"
programme.desc: Who decides the law in space? And how will it be enforced?

programme.title: Wonder S1 - "Phenomenal"
programme.desc: In this episode we learn the diference between Iridescence, Chemiluminescence and Bioluminescence. We also learn about Gemstone Coloration and Mechanical Plant Defenses.

programme.title: Wonder S1 - "Sensory Tricks"
programme.desc: In the last episode of the season we'll learn about sensory tricks - visually-evoked auditory response, retinal fatigue, Müller-Lyer illusion, Ames room and synesthesia.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "Perpetual Power"
programme.desc: All over the world, engineers and scientists are racing to solve one key problem: how to safely and efficiently store electricity at a huge scale but at a low cost.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S2 - "Timber Skyscraper"
programme.desc: This film explores the mind-blowing world of timber buildings for a more sustainable future.

programme.title: Suppressed Science S1 - "Merging Man & Machine"
programme.desc: Why fear the rise of the machines, when we can merge and rise along with them?

programme.title: Suppressed Science S1 - "The Suppressed Science Of Psychedelics"
programme.desc: Join Athena as she explores the underground world of psychedelic science, and the revolutionary impact it is poised to have on the pharmaceutical industries.

programme.title: Suppressed Science S1 - "Race: Science, Social Construct, or Both?"
programme.sub-title: Race: Science, Social Construct, or Both?
programme.desc: The concept of race was invented during colonial and imperialist eras as a means to reify political power structures.

programme.title: Suppressed Science S1 - "Weather Control: The Debate Over Geo-Engineering"
programme.sub-title: Weather Control: The Debate Over Geo-Engineering
programme.desc: In this episode, Athena takes on the controversial topic of Geoengineering, and meets scientists working on an ambitious plan to put a shield around the planet.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S2 - "Tim Cridland"
programme.desc: Thom Hunt heads to Las Vegas to meet Tim Cridland, a sideshow performer who claims to be pain-proof.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S2 - "Ron White"
programme.desc: Thom Hunt travels to the US to track down Ron White, a man whose mind-blowing memory powers defy belief.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S2 - "Igor Zaripov"
programme.desc: Thom heads to Nevada, to find a man who defies human biology. Igor Zaripov performs mind-blowing feats of power using only the might of his jaw.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S2 - "Scott Flansburg"
programme.desc: Thom’s in Nevada, tracking down world record-holding mathlete Scott Flansburg, who’s able to crunch numbers faster than a calculator.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Feeding The Billions"
programme.desc: We explore potential new strategies to satisfy the growing food demand, from restaurants growing potatoes in the air to jellyfish as a potential sustainable meat alternative.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "The People's Voice"
programme.desc: We meet grassroots movements in US and UK who are fighting for a political intervention to stop climate change.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Plastic Into Products"
programme.desc: We meet enviro-entrepreneurs who recycle plastic waste to produce a large variety of items from fishing boats to coffee cups.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Rewilding Patagonia"
programme.desc: We visit Patagonia National Park to find out how it became one of the biggest conservation projects in history.

programme.title: Silly Sustainability S1 - "Can You Power A Lawnmower With Grass?"
programme.sub-title: Can You Power A Lawnmower With Grass?
programme.desc: Andy from the Youtube channel 'How To Make Everything' tests if he can use clippings from mowing his lawn to create fuel that powers the very lawnmower he uses to do so.

programme.title: Silly Sustainability S1 - "Cardboard Lumber Part 1"
programme.desc: In our new series with Andy from @How To Make Everything, we're exploring if household recyclabes can be turned into a lumber substitute.

programme.title: Silly Sustainability S1 - "Cardboard Lumber Part 2"
programme.desc: In our new series with Andy from @How To Make Everything, we're exploring how to mass-produce building materials from household recyclabes.

programme.title: Silly Sustainability S1 - "K-Cups/Recycled Plastic Into Shows"
programme.desc: K-Cups have made our morning routine wonderfully easier, bue we know that they create a lot of excess waste.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "The Future of Outer Space"
programme.desc: Join host Joe Penna as he talks to pioneers in the future of space.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "The Future of Driving"
programme.desc: Join host Joe Penna as he discovers where this invention is headed in the run-up to 2050.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "The Future of 3D Printing"
programme.desc: Join host Joe Penna as he meets pioneers in the field of 3D printing.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S1 - "The Future of The Oceans"
programme.desc: Join host Joe Penna as he visits with developers who are turning to the ocean as a renewable source of power.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "The Launchers"
programme.desc: This episode examines a range of launchers that are integral to space research.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Mars"
programme.desc: This episode looks at the work of the probes orbiting Mars and the rovers exploring its surface.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Saturn"
programme.desc: This episode reveals the work done by the Cassini probe that spent more than 13 years examining the Saturnian system.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "The International Space Station"
programme.desc: This episode exposes the working life of people who spend months orbiting in micro gravity.

programme.title: The New Frontier S2 - "Danger Asteroids Ahead"
programme.desc: The question often rises is the cost of space exploration really worth it? Could the money be better spent elsewhere. If so one space program would have to remain. The planetary defence program, to locate identify and deflect a wayward asteroid.

programme.title: The New Frontier S2 - "First Light"
programme.desc: For an instrument first developed as recently as the 17th century, the telescope has travelled a long way. The latest version of the once-humble telescope will be going a lot farther – carrying us ever closer to the first light.

programme.title: The New Frontier S2 - "Stars Above"
programme.desc: Stars are a bit like human beings. They can be warm or cold, they come in all kinds of shapes and sizes… and, let’s face it, they can be dim or bright. Recent discoveries suggest the number of stars in our galaxy alone may exceed 200 billion.

programme.title: The New Frontier S2 - "The Dark Side"
programme.desc: Perhaps that American politician was right. There are indeed things we know we don’t know. For instance, cosmologically speaking, we know we don’t know much – and certainly not nearly enough – about two of the enduring mysteries of the Universe.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Science on Fire"
programme.desc: This week's experiments investigate how you can burn metal using only a 9 volt battery, what fire can teach us about calories, and why a little bit of sodium can cause a gigantic explosion.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Invisible Impacts"
programme.desc: This week's experiments explore the resonant frequencies of bridges and human bodies, the mind boggling world of quantum levitation, and how to whip up the conditions to recreate nature's scariest cyclone: a fire tornado.

programme.title: How to Bulid a City S1 - "Tokyo"
programme.desc: Home to more than 37 million people, Greater Tokyo is the largest city in the world. To say it’s crowded is nothing short of an understatement. Join us as we navigate this gargantuan yet liveable city that still manages to function on a human scale.
